english: The rest of the Bay is ambushed.

text: Artuk Bey’le obaya dönen iki Alp şehit olmuş beyim.
english: I'm a gentleman who's been a two-time Alpine martyr returning to the village with Artuk Bey.
So that's not what came to the village.

text: Bir iz, bir ipucu var mıdır?
Gündüz Alp’le Süleyman, Alpleri yanına alıp, tez aramaya çıkmışlar.
english: And they took the Alps and Solomon by day, and went out to seek the Alps.
Sir, who's taking the Artuk Bey?

text: Artuk Bey bizim bütün sırlarımıza vakıftır Bamsı.
english: Mr. Artuk is the founder of all our secrets, Bamshi.
Those who wanted our secret kidnapped him.

text: Artuk Bey nice eziyet görse de ağzından tek kelam çıkmaz.
english: Artuk, no matter how much he suffers, not a word comes out of his mouth.

text: Lakin biz tez elden onu bulup...
english: But we quickly found him and...

text: ...ona bunu yapanların başına da gök kubbeyi yıkacağız!
english: ...and we'll blow the dome on those who did this!

text: Gerekirse yerin yedi kat dibine kadar bakın!
english: Look seven stories down if you have to!
- Don't come back until you find them, Turgut!
You have the pressure, the Alps of Ertuğrul!
We're not going to run out of money!

text: Alpler! Tez o itin peşine düşün!
Mergen, sen de Ertuğrul Bey'e haber edesin. Hadi.
english: Mergen, you should call Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Ne etti bu zalimler gözlerine Artuk Bey?
english: What have these evil men done to your eyes, Mr. Artuk?
We're the ones who keep our secret.
I hope we find your cure, Mr. Artuk.
Let's bring Mr. Artuk up to the village.

text: Dağ gibi alın teri onlara kalacak beyim.
english: Take the skin like a mountain, sir.

text: Turgut’um, diyelim ki düşman kalenin dört bir tarafını sardı.
english: Turgutum, let's say the enemy has surrounded the castle.
You won't be able to fight.
I will defend you to the death, sir.

text: Beyim, son çare, kaleden çıkar, üzerlerine akın ederim.
english: Sir, last resort, get out of the fortress, I'll rush over them.

text: Kalenin kapılarını açar, terk ederim Bamsı.
english: He opens the castle doors, I leave Bamshi.

text: Bazı vakitler kaleyi terk etmekte fayda vardır.
english: Sometimes it's good to leave the castle.

text: Kaleyi terk ettiğinde düşman içeri doluşur Turgut.
english: When you leave the castle, the enemy will be full of Turgut.

text: Onlar kaleyi zapt ettim diye mestliğini yaşarken…
english: When they were in the majesty of the castle...

text: …sen kalenin etrafını kuşatır, onları içeri hapsedersin.
english: ...you surround the castle, you lock them in.

text: Onlara bıraktığın kale aslında onların mezarıdır.
english: The castle you left them is actually their grave.
...and you will not destroy the castle to them.

text: Akıl odur ki yarın alacağı onu, bugün vereceği bire tercih eder.
english: The wise man would rather have what he gets tomorrow than what he gives today.

text: …ondan sonra o kaleden alacağımız yalnızca altınlar değil…
english: ...after which we will not only take gold from that fortress...

text: Peki beyim, sen onlara istediklerini verince…
english: Well, sir, when you give them what they want...
They won't give it to you, Bams.

text: Onların tek derdi İlbilge Hatun değildir.
english: Their only problem is not the Elderly.
What are we gonna do, sir?

text: Gel şu peynirlerin, pekmezin tadına bir bakalım.
english: Come on, let's try some of those cheeses and some of that bacon.
Hey, my sister, are you okay?

text: Bu itler Ertuğrul Bey'in seni öldürdüğünü söylemişti ağabey.
english: These dogs said that Mr. Ertuğrul killed you, brother.
And to expose the traitors within us...
...and to save the life of Ilbilge Hatun...

text: ...hem de keferenin tuzağına son vermek için seni öldürmüş gibi yapacağım.
english: ...and I'll pretend to kill you to end the frog trap.
To make up for the mistake you made...
...to save the life of the wise Hatun...
Since my sister's life depends on it...
Now we have to convince everyone that he's dead.
If death is death, Lord Ertuğrul.

text: Ertuğrul Bey seni kurtarmak için gerekeni yaptı İlbilge.
english: Lord Ertuğrul did what he had to do to save you, Ilbilge.

text: Allah Ertuğrul Bey'den de sizden de razı olsun.
english: May Allah be pleased with Ertuğrul Bey and you.
I'm not a big fan of this.
You risked your life for me.

text: Bu uğursuz yerden tez çıkmalıyız bacım.
english: We must get out of this miserable place soon, sister.
You're going to wear these, sister.
Sir, the infidel is not in place!
He escaped from his room, sir.

text: Bu dizinin betimlemesi Tekden Film tarafından...
english: This series is being described by One-Fact...
...was made into the Audio Impression Society.
We were gonna make a deal with you.
But you killed and kidnapped my soldiers, Ilbilge.
I brought you the gold of my own free will.
But you tried to stop Ilbilge.

text: ...benim vermediğim bir şeyi benden alıkoyamaz komutan.
english: ...you can't keep something from me that I don't give you, Commander.
Then why did you bring the gold?

text: Lakin İlbilge Hatun bu pazarlığın mevzusu olmayacak.
english: But Ilbilge Hatun will not be the subject of this negotiation.
What did you leave to settle?
You haven't heard my main offer yet, Dragos.
Kill me here if you want.
There's no such thing as a zero-sum game.

text: Lakin beni öldürsen büyük teklifimi duyamazsın.
english: But if you kill me, you won't hear my big offer.

text: Hem burada olduğumu bilen Türk obaları da...
english: And the Turkish villagers who know I'm here...
...they will destroy this castle on your head.

text: Köstebeğin kazdığı çukur sizi yanlış yere çıkardı.
english: The pit the sparrow dug led you to the wrong place.

text: Ölmediği gibi, İlbilge Hatun’u da ona kaçırttım.
english: I took Ilbilge Hatunu to him, just as he didn't die.

text: İmdi sen nasıl ki benim hanıma gelip...
english: How come you came to my lady...

text: ...bana bir şey olursa İlbilge Hatun ölür dedin...
english: ...you said if anything happened to me, the Elderly would die...
(Sighs) And you take that into account...
He'll talk about my big offer...
Take your sword, and then get out!

text: Benim vermediğim bir şeyi kimse benden alamaz!
english: No one can take what I don't give!

text: Moğollara gidecek olan vergiler Anadolu'da bir yerde toplanacaklar.
english: The taxes that go to the Mongols will be collected somewhere in Anatolia.

text: O vergileri birlikte ele geçirmek isterim.
english: I'd like to take those taxes together.

text: Getirisi de götürüsü kadar büyük bir iş.
english: It's as big a job as taking it.
His responsibility is in Emir Bahaddin.

text: O vergileri alırsak hem büyük bir servete sahip oluruz...
english: If we get those taxes, we'll have a huge fortune...
...and the Mongols will kill Emir Bahaddin.
Why don't you do this alone?
They know me and my Alps.

text: Oysa ben vergilerin toplandığı yeri size bildirirsem...
english: But if I tell you where the taxes are collected...

text: İki taraf da üzerine düşeni yapmış olur.
english: Both sides have done their part.
I'll think about it and make my decision.
...we can have a great army with these gold.

text: Beyim, içeride ne ettiniz? Nereye gidersin?
english: Sir, what have you done in there?
You must not imagine me, Abdurrahman.
Send a message to the Alps and the Sultans below.
Get the sparrow out of the nest.

text: Ertuğrul kestirip atamayacağımız bir teklif sundu.
english: Ertugrul made an offer we can't take off.

text: Önce sizinle konuşmak için gönderdim onu.
english: I sent him to talk to you first.
...don't be so crushed in front of him.

text: ...düşmanlarımızın karşısında hiçbir zaman bu kadar hafif kalmaz!
english: ...never so lightly faced by our enemies!
He said he saw Beybolt's death with his own eyes.
It seems Ertuğrul has found our spider.

text: Ertuğrul’u da hâlâ öldürme şansımız var.
english: We still have a chance to kill Ertuğrul.

text: Getirdiği altınların, malzemelerin ne önemi var?
english: What's the point of the gold, the materials he's bringing?
You didn't hear what he offered?

text: Ayrıca ona bir şey olursa Türkler kaleye saldırır.
english: Besides, if anything happens to him, the Turks will attack the castle.

text: Söğüt’ü almak isterken kaleyi kurtarmaya çalışmak olmaz.
english: You can't try to save the castle when you want to take the bait.

text: Savaş bir yana, esas önemli olan sunduğu teklif.
english: The war aside, the main thing is the offer he makes.
So, can we trust Ertuğrul, sir?

text: Benim kafamı kurcalayan da bu zaten.
english: That's what's been blowing my mind.

text: Ya bu işin içinde bir oyun varsa?
english: What if there's a game in this?

text: ...ve daha önemlisi kendimizi tehlikeye atmış olacağız.
english: ...and more importantly, we'll have put ourselves at risk.

text: Ertuğrul bizi zorlu bir eşiğe çekti.
english: Ertuğrul has brought us to a difficult threshold.
We're going to play a game.

text: Ama belki de Ertuğrul’u öldürmek varken buna değmez.
english: But maybe it's not worth it when you have to kill Ertuğrul.

text: Ağabeyimin sağ olduğunu, ablamın kurtarılacağını söyledin.
english: You said my brother was alive, my sister was going to be rescued.

text: Evelallah gelecekler, sapasağlam gelecekler Sırma Hatun.
english: They'll come with God, they'll come in peace, Serma Hatun.
I hope you're not setting me up.
What's the matter with the inn, buddy?
The weather's good in the suburbs, buddy.

text: Oğuz da birkaç güne dipdiri olur evelallah.
english: And his son will be in the water for a few days.

text: Ağabey, bir an öldüğüne inandım, aklımı kaybedecek gibi oldum.
english: Brother, I thought you were dead for a moment, I was going to lose my mind.
It was all a game, sister.
As you can see, I'm safe.
How did you get out of that fort?

text: Sağ olsun Ertuğrul Bey'in yaptığı kusursuz oyun sayesinde…
english: Thanks to the perfect play of Mr. Ertuğrul...
...we came out of the castle like a hairdresser.

text: Ertuğrul Bey’in pusatı gibi aklı da keskinmiş.
english: He's as sharp as the head of Ertuğrul Bey'in.

text: Hem de bizi kurtarıp kendini feda edecek kadar da yürekli.
english: And he's brave enough to save us and sacrifice himself.
Is Mr. Ertuğrul still in the castle?

text: Ertuğrul Bey nasıl çıkacak o kaleden?
english: How will Mr. Ertuğrul get out of that fort?

text: Beyim her türlü ihtimale karşı bütün tedbirleri aldırdı.
english: The master took all precautions against all odds.

text: Bizim de Söğüt’e dönüp teyakkuzda kalmamızı buyurdu.
english: He told us to return to the shore.

text: O kaleye nasıl girdiyse öyle çıkacaktır.
english: He'll come out just as he entered that castle.
Did you think about what I said?

text: O altınların hepsini alacağız ve yarı yarıya paylaşacağız.
english: We'll take all that gold and split it in half.

text: Umarım bu iş birliğimiz daha uzun yıllar devam eder.
english: I hope this partnership will last for years to come.

text: Hele bu işi bir yapalım, gerisi hayırlısıysa mutlaka olacaktır.
english: Let's do this one thing, and the rest will be better.

text: Senden altınların toplanacağı yerin bilgisini bekleyeceğim.
english: I'll wait for you to tell me where the gold is going to be collected.

text: Eğer bu işin içinden bir oyun çıkarsa...
english: If there's a game out of this...

text: ...bir daha geri dönüşü olmayan bir savaşa gireriz, bilmiş ol.
english: ...we're going to go to war with no turning back, you know.

text: Madem iş birliği yaptık, sana bir tavsiye.
english: If we're cooperating, I'll give you a piece of advice.

text: Sakın kazanamayacağın bir savaşı aklına bile getirme.
english: Don't even think of a war you can't win.

text: Sonrası senin için geri dönüşü olmayan bir pişmanlık olur.
İmdi kalende oturup benden haber bekle.
english: Now sit in the castle and wait for me.

text: Askerlerim sana kalenin çıkışına kadar eşlik etsinler.
english: Let my soldiers escort you out of the castle.

text: Bu kalenin bütün giriş çıkışlarını senden iyi bilirim ben.
english: I know all the entrances and exits to this castle better than you.
How did you get into my house?
How did you sneak into us?

text: ...ben de evine öyle girdim Mikis! He mi?
english: I walked into your house like that, Mikis!
I don't know what you mean.

text: Benden ne istiyorsunuz? Ben bir şey yapmadım.
english: What do you want from me?

text: Ertuğrul Bey'imiz geldiğinde sana diyecek ne olduğunu.
english: When our Lord Ertuğrul comes, he will tell you what happened.
What the hell is going on here?

text: (Tara iç ses) Gidip Komutan Dragos'a haber vermeliyim.
english: (Sighs) I have to go and report to Commander Dragos.

text: Çok şükür bu badireyi de atlattık.
english: Thank God we got through this mess.

text: Gayrı beyliğimizi ilgilendiren tek mesele Emir Bahaddin Hazretleri'yle...
english: The only thing that concerns our non-governmental body is that with His Majesty Emir Bahaddin...
...to carry out the will of the Illuminati.
Come on, sister, have a seat.

text: Beyliğimizin istikbali senin iki dudağının arasındadır.
english: Our ability is stable between your two lips.

text: Bak bacım, sen gel ağabeyini dinle.
english: Look, sister, you come and listen to your brother.

text: Emir Bahaddin Selçuklu Sarayı'nın en muteber adamlarındandır.
english: Emir Bahaddin is one of the most honorable men in Selcuk Palace.
If there is, there is, if there is, there is.

text: Beni ilgilendirmez! Sarayı da kudreti de onun olsun.
english: It's none of my business, let him have the palace and the power.

text: Benim dikbaşlı bacım, kız gönlü naz gönlüdür, bilirim.
english: My stubborn sister, she's a heart-wrenching girl, I know.

text: Lakin sen de şunu bil, Emir Bahaddin...
english: But you know what, Emir Bahaddin...

text: ...hem Selçuklu hem de Moğol ümerası tarafından sevilip sayılmakta.
english: ...loved and respected by both the Seljuk and the Mughal Ummah.

text: Abla, senin buna evet demen güçlü bir Umuroğulları demektir.
english: Sister, if you say yes to this, it means a powerful Umuro.
- My brother wants to say that.

text: Israra lüzum yoktur. Bu meselede fikrim katidir.
english: I don't have to insist, I'm firm on this.
I will not marry Emir Bahaddin!

text: Laftan anlamaz mısın sen? Gönüllü olmazsa gönülsüz.
english: Don't you understand, if not voluntarily, voluntarily?

text: Dirini vermezsem, ölünü veririm Emir Bahaddin'e.
english: If I don't give you the living, I'll give you the dead to Emir Bahaddin.

text: Lakin ben "Beybolat Bey sözünü yedi." dedirtmem!
english: But I'm not saying "Mr. Beybolát has broken his word".

text: Beybolat menfaati için bacısını Emir Bahaddin'e verdi dedirtirsin, öyle mi?
english: You're saying she gave her sister to Emir Bahaddin for Beybolat's benefit?
What if you say yes to this...

text: ...ya da Umuroğulları Obası'nı bir daha rüyanda dahi göremezsin.
english: ...or you'll never dream of the Umuro House again.

text: İlbilge, aklını başına topla, iyi düşün.
english: I'm not going to let you get away with this.

text: Yoksa seni Alaiye'ye, teyzemizin yanına sürerim, bilesin.
english: Or I'll drive you to Alaiye, to our aunt, you know.
You've been with us for all these years, Mikis.

text: Bizden ne kötülük gördün de bize ihanet ettin?
english: What wrong have you done to us that you betray us?
I didn't see any evil in you.
What are we gonna forgive, Mikis?

text: Bizde ihanet cezasız kalmaz, bilmez misin?
english: Don't you know that betrayal is not always unpunished?

text: Beni en zayıf yerimden vurdular beyim.
english: They shot me from my weakest spot, sir.

text: Karımı, çocuğumu kaçırdılar. Beni mecbur bıraktılar.
english: My wife, my child, they forced me.
Otherwise, I would never betray you.

text: Madem aileni kaçırdılar ne diye gelip bize demedin?
english: If they took your family, why didn't you come and tell us?

text: Neden Ertuğrul Bey aileni sorduğunda yalan söyledin?
english: Why did Mr. Ertuğrul lie to your family when you asked?
I was scared, sir, I was scared.

text: Size bir şey söylersem karımı öldüreceklerini söylediler.
english: They said they'd kill my wife if I told you anything.
If you want to save your family...

text: ...hem de o Dragos soysuzunu yakalamam için kimlerle iş birliği yaptığını...
english: ...and who he's working with to get that dragos offspring...
I've never seen a guy named Dragos.
They've always told me about him.

text: Ona çok saygı duydukları ve ondan çok korktukları belli.
english: They respect him very much and they're afraid of him.
Who were the people who were in contact with you?

text: Niko ve Teo öldükten sonra Tara üzerinden benimle bağlantı kurdu.
english: He contacted me through Tara after Niko and Teo died.

text: Eğer başka kimse var da bana demezsen...
english: If you don't tell me there's anyone else...
I swear to God, I'm telling the truth.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'im seni pazardaki vazifenden azletti.
english: My lord Ertuğrul has dismissed you from your position at the market.

text: Ailen bulunana kadar da zindanda kalacaksın.
english: You'll be in jail until your parents are found.

text: Ondan sonra da Söğüt'ten defolup gideceksin.
english: And after that, you'll be out of the Sultaneous.

text: Günkut'la beraber Tara'yı derdest edip bize getirin.
english: Bring Tara and Genkut to us.
- The Alps are ready, aren't they?
I was nervous, my friend, my friend.

text: Beyim az daha gelmez ise ok gibi dalalım keferenin kalesine.
english: If my master doesn't come any more, we'll go to the castle of the shrimp like arrows.
Is my master still in the castle?

text: Bir gün o kalede kalırsam bil ki orayı fethetmişizdir Bamsı.
english: If I stay in that fort one day, you know we've conquered it, Bamshi.
- It's a pleasure to meet you, sir.

text: Beyim, yoksa o kancığın kellesini atının terkisine asıp getirdin mi?
english: Sir, did you just hang that cocksucker's head from his horse's trunk?

text: Bir gün o da olacak Bamsı. Her şeyi konuşacağız.
english: One day she'll be Bamshi, and we'll talk about everything.

text: Mikis'i alıp öttürdük, Tara üzerinden irtibat kurarlarmış.
english: We took Mikis and killed him, and they were communicating through Tara.

text: Onu da yakalamaları için Alpleri gönderdim.
english: I sent the Alps to catch him.

text: İlbilge Hatun nerededir Turgut? İyi midir?
english: Where is the eponymous Hatun Turgut?
- It's a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Ertuğrul.
We thought my brother was dead.

text: Meğer her şey ablamı kurtarmak içinmiş. Sağ olun.
english: It's all about saving my sister.
Thanks to you, I'm fine, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Eğer sen o kefere elinden dönmeseydin, benim kurtulmamın da bir manası olmazdı.
english: If you hadn't turned your back on that mess, there would be no point in me getting away.
No one will ever get in your way again.

text: Tekerinize taş değmeyecek. Pusatım bunun teminatıdır.
english: You won't hit your wheel with a stone, and my hub is a guarantee.

text: Eğer yol hayırlıysa taştan perva olmaz.
english: If the road is good, the stone will not be perverted.

text: Lakin yolun sonu karanlığa çıkacaksa olmasa yeğ.
english: But if the road ends in darkness, it's better not.

text: Allah yolun da hayırlısına revan olmayı nasip etsin inşallah, var olasın.
english: And Allah may give you the best way, so that you may be successful.
I'm going to be a little late.
Come on, you guys go back to the village.

text: Ben burada kalıp Ertuğrul Bey'le biraz daha konuşacağım.
english: I'll stay here and talk to Mr. Ertuğrul for a while longer.

text: Biz ekmek, tuz hakkı biliriz Ertuğrul Bey.
english: We know the truth about bread and salt, Mr. Ertuğrul.
I will never forget your bravery.

text: Bu mesele iki obanın da pekişmesine vesile olacaktır.

english: - I'd like to talk to you alone.

text: Bunların bükümlerini iyi vermedin mi kızım, ip olmaz.
english: You don't get the twists right, girl, you don't get the rope.

text: İp olmadı mı da çorap da örülmez, yelek de.
english: If there's no rope, no socks, no vest.
Selcan, I'll call you my girl.
What kind of a dick is that?
I'm sorry, Mom, I didn't hear that.

text: Neden öyle dalıp dalıp gidersin kızım?
english: Why are you digging and digging, girl?

text: Çok şükür oban geldi, Süleyman'ım yanında.
english: Thank God you're here, my Solomon is with you.

text: Öyle de ana, bir yarım orada kaldı.
english: And yet, Mother, she stayed there for half an hour.
I still have no news of my sunrise.
My daughter, you'll be the text.

text: Sen dik duracaksın ki seninle gelenler de vakur olsun.
english: You stand upright so that those who come with you will be honored.
But my heart is breaking, Mother.

text: Biz kız uşak düştük yollara, geldik buraya.
english: We, the girl servants, fell down the road, we came here.

text: Gündoğdu Bey'im gardaşlarıyla dağ başında, hem de bu soğukta.
english: My lord is at the top of the mountain with his men, in the cold.

text: Önlerinde çaşıt, gerilerinde düşman, ne eder kim bilir?
english: Confusion ahead of them, enemy behind them, who knows what?
With his friends, with his son.
And every morning of the night...

text: Koy verme kendini. Hem bak, Ertuğrul Bey söz verdi.
english: Don't give up, and look, Mr. Ertuğrul promised.

text: Verdi, Allah bin kere razı olsun.
english: He gave, God bless him a thousand times.

text: Lakin Ertuğrul Bey'imin başı kalabalıktır ana.
english: But my lord Ertuğrul is a mob.

text: Ertuğrul Bey'imiz o kaleden sağ çıktı ya, şu badireleri atlatsın...
english: Our Lord Ertuğrul has survived that fort, let him pass these ravages...
...his first job will be to reach out to his colleagues.
And you told them you kidnapped Ilbilge...
...and you came out of it healthy.

text: Yaptığım anlaşma imdi onlara yarar, sonra bana yarayacak.
english: The deal I made is good for them, then good for me.

text: Gerekirse biz de uç beyimize yardımcı olalım.
english: We can help our brain if we need to.
You'll know if you need to.

text: Bacıma cihan mülkü feda, lakin benden de vergileri beklerler Ertuğrul Bey.
english: My sister's estate is a sacrifice, but they expect taxes from me, too, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Merak etmeyesin. Altınları ziyadesiyle geri alacağız.
english: Don't worry, we'll get the gold back in surplus.

text: Neymiş senin konuşmak istediğin asıl mesele?
english: What is the real point you want to talk about?
Strengthening the bond between the two nations.

text: Bunu tamamına erdirmek, hayırlı bir işle mühürlemek isterim.
english: I want to complete it and seal it with a good deed.

text: Yarın akşam otağımızda bir yemek tertip edeceğim.
english: I'll arrange a meal in our room tomorrow night.

text: Ailece sizin de teşrif etmenizi beklerim.
english: I expect you to identify the family.

text: Hem de bu işi orada konuşuruz.
english: And we'll talk about it there.

text: Ağabeyim bana başka çıkar yol bırakmadı.
english: My brother left me no other way out.

text: Emir Bahaddin'le evlenmektense sürgün benim için yeğdir.
english: I prefer exile to marrying Emir Bahaddin.

text: Başka bir yol, başka bir çare yok mudur?
english: Is there any other way, any other way?

text: Töre belli, nizam belli. Ağabeyim buyurduktan sonra elden ne gelir?
english: The rules are clear, the order is clear, what happens when my brother orders?

text: Bunca yıldır derdine derttaşlık, yoluna yoldaşlık ederim.
english: I've been with you all these years, and I've been your companion.

text: (Mengü) O kor yüreğe düştü mü dumanı ilk gözlerden çıkar.
english: When he falls into the blind heart, smoke comes out of the first eyes.

text: O bakışlar, derininde taşıdığın yangının alazıyla dolu.
english: Those looks are filled with the flame of fire you carry deep inside.

text: Saklama benden hanımım. Gönlünün Ertuğrul Bey'e meylettiğini bilirim.
english: I know your heart is inclined to Mr. Ertuğrul.
It's a dream that never comes true.
Why do you think that, ma'am?
I fell in love with Mr. Ertuğrul.
But I couldn't say, I was afraid.
I was afraid that what I was telling you would not be understood.

text: Beni içinden çıkardığı onca kötülükten sonra...
english: After all the evil he's done to me...

text: ...bana yaptığı onca iyilikten sonra gözünde küçülmekten korktum.
english: ...after all the good he's done me, I was afraid of being underestimated.
The love bird never stops in the cage, ma'am.

text: Ben derim ki sırrını ikrar et, içindeki yangını ona da söyle.
english: I say confess your secret, tell him the fire inside.
Ertuğrul has moved ahead of us.
He found out Mikis worked for us.

text: Evine gittiğimde Ertuğrul'un Alpleri onu götürüyordu.
english: When I went to his house, Ertuğrul's Alps were taking him.
Sir, I failed to do my duty.

text: Bu utançla yaşayamam. Bırakın şurada öldüreyim kendimi.
english: I can't live with this shame.
So what am I gonna do?
...he will certainly give your name to Ertuğrul.
You can't stay in the Sultaneous anymore.
That Anatolian women raise with their tooth, their nails...

text: İti ite kırdırarak yaptıracağız bunu da.
english: We'll do that by breaking the dog to the dog.

text: Diyelim ki bu Dragos'la adamları bu işi becerdiler...
english: Let's just say that Dragos and his men did it...
What if they make a fuss?
What if they can't give half the gold?

text: Onların bize yarısını vermelerine gerek yok Turgut'um.
english: They don't have to give us half of it, Turgut.
When they get out of the tax-collecting caravan...
They won't go to the castle.
They must have a secret growl.
Find out where those guys are.

text: O ini öğrenebilirsek, yalnızca altınları değil...
english: If we can find out what he is, not just the gold...
...and we can catch the real Dragos.

text: Dragos ve adamları, Moğolları öldürüp, altınları alacak.
english: Dragos and his men will kill the Mongols and take the gold.
The Mongols will kill Emir Bahaddin.

text: Biz de Dragos'un inine girip, altınları alacağız.
english: We'll go into the Dragos' quarters and get the gold.

text: Ya beyim, it iti ısırmaz derler ama...
english: Oh, man, they say a dog doesn't bite, but...
...those dogs will tear each other apart.
You're going to the castle of Lefke and...
...you will send them the caravan where the gold is collected, Turgut.

text: Bugüne dek dört koldan üstümüze çullandılar.
english: They've been all over us to this day.

text: İmdi hepsi birbiriyle dalaşsın da bizim aklımız...
english: Now let them all be together and our minds...
...how to align their centers with each other.

text: Düşmanlarıma intikamsız ölüm olmayacağına dair ant içmiştim.
english: I swore to my enemies that there would be no death without revenge.

text: Artuk Bey'i kör ettiren, o kanı bozuk Bahaddin'di.
english: It was the bloodthirsty Bahaddin who blinded Mr. Artuk.
The sword that hides in its shadow...
...when he shot Bahaddin in the head...
...my revenge will be a warning to all.

text: Beyim, düşmanları bir bir telef ettikçe...
english: Sir, as we destroy the enemy one by one...
...we're close to establishing a state, I hope.
We'll fight our way through it.

text: Bir devlet, göğsü hikmet bahçesine dönmüş...
english: A state, a garden of wisdom...
...which rises on the shoulders of the brave, Bamshi.
His legs are steel, his shoulders are so wide...
God has many lions like that.
...when God bestows upon them the blessing of the state...
And they forgot their Lord who bestowed it.
Then they were brought down to the ground.
May God give us strength and...
...not to act on the lust of my place.
I'm going to be a little late.
We told you to find out what the box was!

text: İşe yarar bir malumat al dedik!
english: We said get some useful information!
You didn't learn a damn thing...

text: ...hem de bir tavşan gibi adamları bırakıp kaçtın.
english: ...and you left your men like a rabbit.

text: Sandığı öğrenmek için her şeyi denedim.
english: I tried everything to find out what she thought.

text: Emir Hazretleri, adamın gözlerini dahi kör ettim.
english: Your Highness, I have blinded the man's eyes.
But these guys have their mouths locked.
...the sword of the Mongols is in my throat every day.

text: Sen eline düşmüş adamdan iki kelam laf alamayacaksan...
english: If you can't get two words from the man you're in...

text: Akıllı bir adam, hiçbir şey yapmadan ağzından laf almasını bilir.
english: A smart man knows how to take a word from his mouth without doing anything.

text: ...belki de sandık gerçekten de onlarda değildir.
english: ...and maybe we thought they weren't really in it.

text: Ben, koskoca Emir Bahaddin, onu sana boşuna mı aldırdım?
english: I, the handsome Emir Bahaddin, have taken him for nothing?
Southead's tax squad hasn't arrived yet.
We need to find out soon.
All the taxes collected are here.

text: Bu da vergi vermemeye direnen oba beyinin kafatası.
english: And this is the skull of the village brain that resisted tax evasion.

text: El koyduğumuz altınlarıyla kaplayıp size getirdik.
english: We have covered them with gold that we have taken.
The tax haven't come in yet.
What do you mean, he didn't come?

text: (Erkek) Bunların bir an evvel Hülagü Han'a gitmesi gerek.
english: (Man) These should go to Hullagughan right away.
It's just like when you pile it up.

text: Bir de eksik olmasa, iyi olur!
english: And if it's not missing, it's better!
Where are the taxes of the Sughut?
He's on his way, Commander, he's on his way.

text: Kar, kış, kıyamet şimdi. Ondan geciktiler herhâlde.
english: Snow, winter, the Hour, they're probably late for it.
You're acting like a kid, huh?

text: Hiçbiri karda, kışta kalmadı da bir tek Söğüt'ünki mi kaldı?
english: None of them stayed in the snow or the winter, so there's only one other Southrod left?
Look, that cup you see in my hand...
...the skull of someone who doesn't want to pay taxes!

text: Eğer en kısa zamanda Söğüt'ün vergileri gelmezse...
english: If the taxes of the Supreme Court do not come soon...
I'll be in the Sultaneous by tonight.
I'll take care of this myself.
Now, give me the time to press the surrender seal.
No seals until they're all finished!

text: Hepsi tamamlanana kadar da senin sorumluluğunda.
english: And until it's all done, it's your responsibility.

text: Ne vakit Söğüt'ün vergileri gelir, o vakit ben teslim alırım.
english: When the tax comes, I'll hand it over.

text: Ha, eğer gelmezse, bu kâğıdı kanınla mühürleyip gönderirim Hülagü Han'a!
english: If he doesn't come, I'll seal this paper with your blood and send it to the Hulagu Khan!

text: (Erkek) İmdi git, bir an önce hallet.
english: (Man) Now go, get it right now.
I hope Ertuğrul sent the unit we've been waiting for.
...it's a caravan on the road outside of the safe.
Who's going to be in the caravan?
We'll let him know when it's over.

text: Bizim zaten olan biten her şeyden haberimiz olur.

english: My lord Ertuğrul, "Everyone should do what he has to do...
"and not to let our trust be wasted".

text: Askerleri toplayın. Komutan Dragos'a da haber verin.
english: Get the troops together and call Commander Dragos.
We'll kill the Mongols and get the gold.
I haven't opened a Tara shop yet.

text: (Dumrul) Evinde de yok. Tüm Söğüt'ü aradık.
Bakmadığımız yer kalmadı, lakin hiçbir yerde yok beyim.
english: There's nowhere we can't look, but there's nowhere, sir.

text: Mikis'i yakalayınca it gibi kuyruğunu kıstırıp kaçmış olmalı.
english: He must have gotten away with a dog-like tail when he caught Mikis.
You guys open your eyes and your ears.

text: Her an her yerden çıkabilir bunlar.
english: They could come out of any place at any time.

text: Beyim, devriye Alplerden de haber geldi.
english: Sir, patrol has heard from the Alps.

text: Emir Bahaddin, Umuroğulları otağına doğru gidermiş.
english: The order is heading for Bahaddin's Umuro House.

text: Bize haber etmediğine göre bunlar yine bir işler karıştırıyor olmalı.
english: Since you didn't tell us, they must be messing up again.
You guys get on with your job.

text: ...İlbilge Hatun'u kaleden, o şeytanların elinden kurtarmışsınız.
english: ...you saved the wise Hatun from the castle, from the hands of those demons.
Your heroism is in the language of everyone in the Sughut.
Oh, my God, my God, Zangoch.

text: Bir uç beyi olarak vazifemi yaptım ben.
english: I did my duty as a gentleman.

text: Tanrı sizi korusun. Tanrı sizi korusun.
english: God bless you, God bless you.

text: (Dragos iç ses) Az kaldı Ertuğrul. Çok az kaldı.
(Dragos iç ses) Zamanı gelince üzerine düşen sadece benim elimden ölmek olacak.
english: (Dragos whispers) When the time comes, it's my hands that will kill you.
The Bahaddin order has sent word.

text: Bu akşam otağımıza gelecek. Hiçbir işte kusur istemem, bilesin.
english: He's coming to our room tonight, and I don't want to miss a thing.

text: Buyruk senindir ağabey. Sen hiç tasa etme. Her bir şeyi tamam ederiz.
english: You're the one who's in charge, brother, don't you ever think about it.
Considering the condition of our first-time nurse...

text: ...koskoca Selçuklu Devleti'nin emirine sirke ikram eder.
english: ...to offer the wine at the behest of the Seljuk State.

text: ...sen de ağabeyine karşı öyle mi olursun bacım?
english: ...and you're going to be like that with your brother, sister?
Instead of doing what we're ordered to do...
You weren't as stubborn as that goat.

text: Sen ne dersen onu yapmak benim boynumun borcudur ağabey.
english: It's my neck's duty to do whatever you say, brother.
We're invited to the Umuro House room tomorrow, Mother.

text: İade-i ziyaret elzemdir oğul. İyi olmuş.

english: ...to prepare gifts suitable for the bride's bride.

text: Merak etmeyesin anam. Bizzat kendim ilgilenirim.
english: Don't worry, Mom, I'll take care of it myself.
But the only reason we're leaving...

text: Beybolat Bey benimle hayırlı bir mesele görüşmek istermiş.
english: Beybolat wants to discuss a good matter with me.
It was to strengthen the brotherhood of the two cities.

text: Belli ki aramızda akrabalık tesis etmek ister ana.
english: Obviously, she wants to establish a kinship between us.

text: Öyleyse seni bacısı Sırma Hatun'la evlendirmek niyetindedir beyim.
english: So I intend to marry you to your sister Serma Hatun, sir.

text: İlbilge Hatun'u Emir Bahaddin'le evlendirmek ister zira.
english: Because Ilbilge wants to marry Khatun with Emir Bahaddin.

text: ...sen elbet her şeyin en iyisini bilirsin.

english: ...it was obvious they would do something like this.

text: Eğer tahmin ettiğimiz gibi bir teklifle gelirlerse...
english: If they come up with an offer like we thought...

text: ...senin vereceğin karara uymak elbet boynumuzun borcudur beyim.
english: ...that we must obey your decision, sir.

text: İmdi sen de başı dumanlı yengeni dinleyesin.
english: Now you listen to the smoky little one.

text: İçime doğar beyim, hissederim. Tekin değildir bunlar.
english: I'm born with it, sir, I can feel it.

text: Bildiğin, duyduğun bir şey var mıdır Selcan Hatun?
english: Is there anything you know, anything you've heard, Selcan Hatun?

text: Geldiği günden beri ılık ılık konuşur.
english: He's been talking hot and cold ever since he came in.

text: İmdi bir oyun etmesinden korkarım beyim.
english: I'm afraid he's playing a game now, sir.

text: Ağzında bal olan arının, kuyruğunda da iğnesi vardır.
english: The bee with honey in its mouth has a needle in its tail.
...that is not broken by the scruples of Selcan Hatun.
But I'll give you all the credit for what you've said.

text: Gerekli hazırlıkları da yaptım, merak etmeyesin.
english: I've made the necessary preparations, don't worry.
Let's get to the bottom of this.
Selcan Hatun's right about that, Mom.
Because Emir is very close to Bahaddin.

text: ...bana böyle bir teklifle gelmesi boş değildir.
english: ...and he's not coming to me with an offer like that.

text: İşin o tarafını sen daha iyi bilirsin oğul.
english: You know that side of the story better than me, son.
You almost raised your kids alone.
I know your love for Halime.
...the pillar of my nose is leaking.
What shall we do, thank-you is divine.
The Umuro came here on the orders of the state.

text: Bu yalnız vergi toplamak için değil...
english: It's not just to collect taxes...

text: ...onlar üzerinden üzerimize oynanan başka hesaplar da vardır.
english: ...and other accounts played on us through them.
...the union of the two parties is important.

text: Umuroğulları üzerinden hain emeller güdenlere karşı...
english: Betrayal by the Umuro's sons against the...
...if we can get the Umuro boys to our own ranks...

text: Benim gönlüm Halime'den başkasını görmez ana.
english: My heart sees only Halime, mother.
It turned out to be true what Ertuğrul said.
(Dragos) The tax dollars are collected in the caravan here.
How are we going to get in, sir?

text: Sen içeri süzülerek bir yılan gibi sinsice gireceksin.
english: You'll sneak in like a snake.
We'll take care of the rest.

text: Siz zangoç kılığında Ertuğrul'un en yakınına kadar sokulup...
english: You're in the most intimate position of Ertuğrul in the clown costume.

text: Benim için de içeride bir hizmetlinin yerini almak...
english: And for me, taking the place of a maid inside...

text: Akşam şölen vaktinde onlara zevkle hizmet et Uranos.
english: Enjoy serving them during the evening feast, Uranus.

text: Yeryüzünün efendisi Hülagü Han'ın büyük nökerleri!
english: The great servants of Hulagu Khan, the lord of the earth!
Glorious warriors who rule the world with their swords!

text: Döktüğünüz düşman kanından daha lezzetli olan bu şarabı tatmak istemez misiniz?
english: Would you not like to taste this wine, which is more delicious than the blood of the enemy you have shed?

text: Hepsi sizin için getirildi. Kan gibi şarap!
english: It's all brought for you, blood-like wine!
(Man) Fill it up, fill it up!

text: O çok övdüğün şaraptan doldur da tadına bakalım.
english: Fill that wine you praise so much with and taste it.

text: Yalnız esirmezsem kanını içerim, ona göre.
english: If I don't just hang it, I'll drink your blood, she says.

text: Hımm. Güzelmiş. Ne dedin bunun için?
english: What did you say about that?

text: Kan gibi efendim. Kan gibi şarap.
Kan gibi şarap bunlar, kan gibi!
Moğollar vergi, vergi diye tepeme binmişken...
english: The Mongols are on the hill for taxes, taxes...

text: ...şu başımıza gelen işe bak. Hepsi kefereye gitmiş.
Bu vergiler hususunda karşımıza çıkan sorunlar...
english: The problems we're facing with these taxes...
What should I have done, Your Highness?
Should I have left my sister there?

text: Neyse ki o altınlar, İlbilge Hatun'un canının bağışlanması için...
english: Fortunately, those gold were for the life of Ilbilge Khatun...

text: Bir şekilde geri alana dek icabına bakacağız.
english: We'll take care of it until we get it back.

text: Bunun acısını Dragos'tan çok acı şekilde soracağım Emir Hazretleri.
english: I will ask Dragos for the pain of this very painfully, Your Highness.
You can be sure of that.

text: ...şu konuşmayı yaptığımız sıralarda bir celladın baltasının altında olurdun.
english: ...you'd be under the covers of a cell by the time we had this conversation.
Let's see what we can find out.

text: ...bu Ertuğrul nasıl bir anlaşma yapmış Dragos'la?
english: ...what kind of deal did this Ertuğrul make with Dragos?

text: ...Ertuğrul düşündüğümden çok daha iyi bir savaşçı.
english: ...a much better fighter than I thought.

text: Sadece acı kuvvetini değil, aklını da çok iyi kullanır.
english: Not only does he use his painful powers, but he also uses his mind very well.

text: Bakıyorum da Ertuğrul'a hayran olanlar kervanına sen de katılmışsın.
english: I see you've joined the caravan of Ertuğrul's admirers.
Don't forget why you came here.

text: ...ne de buraya neden geldiğim aklımdan çıkmıştır Emir Hazretleri!
english: ...and I can't remember why I came here, Your Highness!
Two swords cannot fit in one blade.

text: Lakin siz de takdir edersiniz ki Ertuğrul gibi bir düşmanı...
english: But you appreciate that an enemy like Ertuğrul...

text: Ben de bunun için başka bir yol buldum.
english: I found another way to do that.

text: Ona diğer kız gardaşım Sırma'yla evlenmesini teklif edeceğim.
english: I'm going to propose to him to marry my other girl cousin Serma.

text: Kayı Obası'na sızıp gücü ele geçirmenin en kestirme yolu bu olsa gerek.
english: This is probably the shortest way to infiltrate the Shipyard and seize power.
And Serma is not like Ilbilge.
He walks in the snow, he doesn't show his tracks.

text: Beyliğimizin menfaatlerine de sıkı sıkıya bağlıdır.
english: It's also very much in the best interests of our ability.

text: Rahle-i tedrisatımızdan geçtiğini imdi belli ettin Beybolat.
english: You've just indicated that Rahle has been through our supply, Beybolat.

text: ...evliliğimiz hususunda İlbilge Hatun henüz kati bir cevap vermedi.
english: ...the Attorney General has not yet responded to our marriage.
The inflection is a little scary.

text: Bu evlilik meselesine yavaş yavaş ısınması gerekir.
english: This marriage issue needs to be warmed up slowly.
I'll talk to him myself and warm him up.

text: Bundan mütevellit, bir müddet burada kalacağım.
english: I'm gonna stay here for a while.

text: Onu tatlı sözlerle yumuşatırım. İkna edeceğime eminim.
english: I'll soften her with sweet words, I'm sure I'll convince her.

text: Yarın akşamki yemekte de olmak isterim.
english: I'd like to be at dinner tomorrow.
It would be a pleasure, and an honor.

text: Hem bakarsın iki hayırlı iş bir arada olur, hı?
english: And you see, two good deeds come together, right?

text: Hem bu süre zarfında Ertuğrul'la da alakadar olmuş olurum.
english: And I'll be able to deal with Ertuğrul in that time.

text: Bir de halletmemiz gereken sandık meselesi var.
english: And there's a box issue we need to address.
Apparently, he didn't drink enough of the blood wine.
You're going to drink it all!
You're going to drink it all!

text: Bugüne kadar kazandığım en büyük zafer.
english: It's the biggest victory I've ever won.
We have all the taxes collected from Anatolia.
We won't just win gold, sir.

text: Burada döktüğümüz kan çok büyük bir katliam yaratacak.
english: The blood we shed here will create a great slaughter.

text: Bu yüzden kazandığım en büyük zafer.
english: That's the greatest victory I've ever won.

text: Yaptığım tek hareketle yer yerinden oynayacak.
english: He'll play from the ground up with the only move I make.
The Mongols will make Anatolia hell.

text: Türklerin kellelerinden dağ yapsınlar! Umurumda değil!
english: I don't care what they do to the Turks!

text: Bundan sonra servet elimde, zafer kılıcımdadır!
english: From now on, wealth is in my hand, and the sword of victory is in my hand!
They've got our eyes on you, but...
...they still have a light heart, sir.

text: O aydınlık çok şükür ki bize ziyadesiyle yetmeye kâfidir.
english: Thankfully, that light is enough for us to have more.

text: Sana bu zulmü reva gören Emir Bahaddin'den...
english: I'm the Emir Bahaddin who has been torturing you.
...and our revenge is near, Mr. Artuk.
I'm gonna make him feel like...

text: ...Moğolların köpekliğini eden kim varsa ibret alacak.
english: ...whoever is a dog of the Mongols will be rebuked.
I have no doubt about that.

text: Bizi parçalamaya çalışan itleri birbirine kırdıracağım.
english: I'm gonna break up the dogs that try to tear us apart.

text: İt, bir değil, iki değil beyim.
english: Dog, not one, not two, sir.
News from Sultan Baybars is coming soon.

text: Bu güzel avrat da bize hizmet edecek.
english: This beautiful abbey will serve us.

text: Benim için kendini de obanı da tehlikeye attın.
english: You put yourself and your family at risk for me.
The honor of the guest at my table is my honor.

text: Onun için değil kendimi, cümle cihanı ateşe atarım İlbilge Hatun.
english: I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that, I'm not going to throw myself in the fire for that.

text: Başın ne vakit dara düşerse, bir haber etmen yeterlidir.
english: When your head falls off a tree, you'll just have to let me know.
Even if you're a genius on the other side of the world...

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Ben Ertuğrul Bey'e sevdalandım...
english: (Shouting out loud) I fell in love with Mr. Ertuğrul...
I couldn't say, I was afraid.

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Anlatmaktan, anlattığımın anlaşılmamasından korktum.
english: (Shouting) I was afraid of telling, of not being understood.

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Beni içinden çıkardığı onca kötülükten sonra...
english: (Sighs outside) After all the evil he's done to me...

text: ...bana yaptığı onca iyilikten sonra gözünde küçülmekten korktum.
english: ...after all the good he's done me, I was afraid of being underestimated.
(Sighs) Do you have a backup, sister?
No, you'd be happy if I went?

text: Bu yüzündeki sevincin sebebi ne öyleyse?
english: What's the joy on your face?
Take the one under your tongue.

text: Ağabeyim, beni Ertuğrul Bey'le evlendirmek ister.
english: My brother wants to marry me to Mr. Ertuğrul.
He's gonna open it up at dinner tomorrow night.

text: Babam bir yandan Türk obalarıyla uğraşır...
english: My father, on the other hand, deals with Turkish villages...
...the Sgt. on one side, the enemy on the other.

text: Bunca derdin içinde onun yükünü biraz almak gerek.
english: With all the trouble, we need to take some of his burden.
I don't know which is harder.

text: Uç beyliği makamı mı, obaları idare etmek mi?
english: The flying board, the village management?

text: Sen ne okursun öyle harıl harıl Savcı?
english: What are you reading, you harsh harsh prosecutor?
He writes healing herbs in this book.

text: Belki Artuk Bey'in gözleri için şifalı bilgiler bulabilirim.
english: Perhaps I can find healing information for Mr. Artuk's eyes.

text: Babam da şifa bulması için gerekeni yapacak ağabey.
english: My father will do whatever it takes to heal, brother.
Wow, haven't you slept yet, lions?

text: Baba, uyku tutmadı. Gardaşlarımla dertleşirdik biraz.
english: Dad, he didn't sleep, we were having a little trouble with my colleagues.
Tell me, what would you be worried about?

text: Onca mesuliyetin vardır, lakin hangisi daha zordur bilemedik.
english: There are so many responsibilities, but we didn't know which one was more difficult.

text: Uç beyliği makamı mı, obaları idare etmek mi?
english: The flying board, the village management?
The most difficult rank is motherhood, fatherhood.
The most important thing is family.

text: Getir bakalım şuradan okla yayları Osman.
english: Get the arrows from here, Osman.
...what is the meaning of three arrows...
The Son is the symbol of the Father's witchcraft.

text: Yay, cihanı bir uçtan bir uca kuşatır.
english: The bow is round the earth from end to end.

text: Oklar da bir uçtan bir uca uzanır.
english: And the arrows are from one end to the other.

text: Bu yay ile üç ok, her şeyden evvel...
english: With this bow, three arrows, first of all...
...the signs of unity, of resurrection, of order.
These must be enforced by rank and file.

text: En başta ve en mühimi de ailedir.
Yay, bir hatun gibi kuşatır, sarmalar, muhafaza eder.
english: The bow, like a chick, surrounds, wraps, guards.

text: Oklar da bir er gibi yayılır, ileri gider.
english: And the arrows spread like a man, going forward.
The unity, the integrity, the order...
...and it's inventive to start with the family.
Who can't keep his family in order, I don't...

text: Bunun içindir ki Oğuz Ata bunları yalnız devlet için değil...
english: That's why the Son of God is not only doing this for the state...

text: ...her şey için bir nizam alameti saymıştır.
english: ...was a sign of order for everything.

text: Bu hikmetle evvela bir aile güçlü olur.
english: With this wisdom, a family is strong.

text: En nihayetinde de cihana nizam verecek bir devlet.
english: A state that will finally put the system in order.
It's the advice of a horse.
The root of all this is family.

text: Nizamı bozuk bir tohum, çınara dönüşemez.
english: A broken seed, it cannot turn to a crumb.

text: Oğullar ne kadar atalarına yaraşır evlatlar olurlarsa...
english: The sons become sons as they deserve their fathers.
I am the god of my heroes.
Come on, you know, let's go.

text: Devlet meselelerinden başımızı kaldırıp da iki kelam edemedik.
english: We couldn't get our heads up on state issues without two words.

text: Söğüt'e adımını attığından bu yana yaşadıkların...
english: You've been through everything since you stepped foot in the ring.
But I can't eat your right.

text: Onca şeye rağmen şuncacık geri adım atmadın.
english: You haven't taken a step back in all this.

text: Devlet meselesinin her hâlükârda yerine getirilmesi gerektiğini...
english: The state's business must be carried out in any case...

text: Her namlı er, senin gibi birini hatunu olarak görmek ister.
english: Every man in the world wants someone like you as his bride.
...a man like you deserves a castle.

text: Taş duvarlarda, görkemli odalarda gözüm yoktur.
english: I have no eyes on stone walls, no eyes on glorious rooms.
My palace is my white room.

text: İnsan tatmadığı nimetin hakkında hüküm veremez.
english: No man can judge a favor he has not tasted.
But if you could taste the palace's glory...

text: ...sen de anlardın güzelliğini buralarda heba ettiğini.
english: ...and you would have known that you were so beautiful.
...you're a jewel who doesn't know your worth.

text: O mücevher, kudretli birinin başında taç olmaya yaraşır.
english: It's a jewel that's worthy of being crowned on the head of a mighty man.

text: İnci de bir mücevherdir Emir Hazretleri.
english: The pearl is a jewel, Your Highness.
But his home is the river.

text: Benim de yurdum, bu görkemiyle baş döndüren ulu ağaçlar yurdudur.
english: My home is the home of the great trees that turn their faces in glory.

text: Akşama gelecek olan misafirler için hazırlık yapmam gerekir.
english: I have to prepare for the guests that are coming this evening.

text: Sana iyi yokla demedim mi? Ne diye bakmazsın?
english: Didn't I tell you to check it out?

text: Akşam hediye gidecek bunlar. Hayme Ana bilhassa tembih etti.
english: These are going to be the evening presents, especially when Haime Ana has warned.

text: Nasıl temsil edeceğiz Kayı hatunlarını bunlarla?
english: How are we gonna represent the Cage girls with these?
Okay, I'll replace it with a good one.

text: Madem iyileri vardı, ne diye bunları getirdin önüme?
english: If there were good ones, why did you bring these to me?
Selcan Hatun, you should not be angry.
You'll do the same for a few.

text: Şu dilimde tüy kalmadı sana laf etmekten.
english: I've got no hair left on my tongue to talk to you.
- Selcan Hatun-- - Although it was my fault.
No dust on your feet, just a little rust in your pants.
- You know what kind of a whore is.

text: Ben bu obada on yıldır saçımı süpürge ettim.
english: I've been brushing my hair in this village for ten years.
The persecution we've not endured has not been stopped.

text: Lakin birbirimizin kalbini hiç böyle kırmadık.
english: But we never broke each other's hearts like that.
I have a reputation for your gentlemanly delicacy.

text: Zorlu hatun görmedikçe diliniz çarık olmuş mübarek.
english: You're lucky your tongue is broken until you see the tough girl.

text: (Selcan) Haddi hududu senden mi öğreneceğim Hafsa Hatun?
english: (Seljan) Do I learn the Haddi Haddi from you Hafsa Hatun?

text: Bu obadaki bütün hatunlar benim kızımdır.
english: All the girls in this village are my daughters.
I'm not crushing one over the other.

text: (At kişneme sesi) Beyim, altınlara ne oldu acep?
english: (Horse ringing) What happened to the gold?

text: Bu kanı bozuk kefereler işi becerebilecek mi?
english: Can these blood-stained cocksuckers do the job?

text: Mergen bir malumat iletti. Dragos'un adamları...
english: The Mergen transmitted a message that the Dragos' men...
- I bought the gold from the Mongols.
Did he find out where they took him?

text: Gizli yeri de öğrenmek için peşlerine düşmüş beyim.
english: I'm after them to find out where they're hiding.
Everything goes the way we want it to.
When I hear about the merger...
- We'll get them to their place.
(Shouting) You're invited to our room tonight.

text: Biz de pazardan eksikleri tamamlayalım dedik.
english: So we thought we'd fill in the blanks.
I'd like to talk to you about something.

text: Hoş geldiniz hanımım. Bir emriniz var mı?
english: Welcome, ma'am, have you got an order?

text: ...her an kendini ateşe atacak heyecanını gördüm.
english: ...I saw the excitement of throwing yourself on fire.

text: İnadıyla nice kalp kıran bir hatuna...
english: To a woman whose hearts are broken...
...you have endured so long, Mr. Ertuğrul.
The one who doesn't want justice...

text: Lakin bu sıralar ağzını bıçak açmaz İlbilge Hatun.
english: But this time, he won't open his mouth, Ilbilge Hatun.
We gave up all that we loved for that.
That's why we're sad and silent.
It's been a while since I've opened my eyes to the...
...my father and I are moving around all the time.
It's the first time we've ever had a hostel.

text: Hem de cennet gibi bir yurt.
Senin gibi bir uç beyinin emrinde yaşayacaktık.
english: We were going to live under the command of a brain like you.
Our graves on the top of the mountain would not be left without property.
Our children will read the Fatima at our graveside...
...it's time for me to leave this beautiful home.

text: Sana çok şey borçluyum Ertuğrul Bey.
english: I owe you a lot, Mr. Ertuğrul.
I'd like to say goodbye to you too.

text: Beybolat Bey neden böyle bir şey yaptı İlbilge Hatun?
english: Why did Beybolat do such a thing, Ilbilge Khatun?

text: Beni Bahaddin’in hatunu olmam için zorladı.
english: He forced me to be the brother of Bahaddin.
...he said he didn't want to see her in his room.
...there is no commandment that is not religious.
Your brother is wrong, Elder Hatun.
For the union of two families...
...the governor wants to make your mistake.
Open up the boxes one by one.

text: Bir oyuna daha gelmeyelim, anlaşıldı mı?
english: Let's not play another game, okay?
...it's time to put down the claw.

text: Bu Moğollar nereyi işgal edeceklerini çok iyi biliyorlar.
english: These Mongols know very well where they're going to occupy.
The coffins are not running out of stone.
That's very nice of you, Mr. Ertuğrul.
It's good to see you again.

text: Geleceğinden haberimiz olsaydı, daha evvelden görüşürdük.
english: If we knew you were coming, we'd have met before.

text: Kayı demircilerinin dillere destan kara çeliğinden.
english: From the iron-smith's tongues of the black steel.
The badge of manhood, of valour and of liberty.
You have worked hard, Mr. Ertuğrul.

text: Bu kara çeliği döven eller dert görmesin.
english: Don't worry about the hands that beat this black steel.

text: Bu kara çeliği döven görklü gözler sönmesin.
english: Let not the glorious eyes of this black steel be extinguished.
- You can't stand up, come to the table.
...and he's been in the wrong place for a while.
...we need to open a new page.

text: Siz sözünüzü tutup ne kadar güçlü olduğunuzu gösterdiniz.
english: You've kept your word and shown how strong you are.
We'll shed as much blood as we can.
We'll win as much gold as we've lost.

text: Çok büyük bir orduya sahip olacağız.
english: We'll have a very large army.

text: Ve bu ordu sayesinde daha büyük zaferler kazanacağız!
english: And with this army, we will achieve greater victories!

text: Altınların yarısını Ertuğrul'a ne zaman vereceğiz efendim?
english: When will we give half the gold to Ertuğrul, sir?

text: Ama bu bir savaşa sebep olmaz mı?
english: But wouldn't that lead to a war?

text: Ele geçirdiğimiz altınlar sayesinde çok güçlü bir ordu toparlayacağız.
english: With the gold we have captured, we will build a very powerful army.

text: Bu yüzden artık savaş çıkmasının bir önemi yok.
english: So it doesn't matter if there's a war going on anymore.
He might even come to our work.

text: Ertuğrul kendisini yok edecek orduyu kurmamıza yardımcı olacak.
english: Ertuğrul will help us build an army to destroy him.

text: Evet. Ertuğrul bize çok büyük bir iyilik yaptı.
english: Ertoğrul has done us a great favor.
But he won't save her from being destroyed.

text: ...bu akşam kalede çok büyük bir ziyafet var.
english: ...there's a big feast at the castle tonight.
(Sword sounds) (Every mouth shouts) Victory is ours!

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Zafer bizimdir! Zafer bizimdir! Zafer bizimdir!
english: We are the victorious, and We are the victorious.

text: (Hep bir ağızdan) Zafer bizimdir! Zafer bizimdir!
english: We shall have victory, and victory shall be ours.

text: ...sadece birer cevval savaşçı değil, aynı zamanda...

english: ...we saw how many cocksuckers there were.
We're pleased to see you like us.
We're very happy to have you, and we're very happy with your chauffeur.
(Bahaddin) As the commander of the Seljuk State...

text: ...bizi mesut eden başka şeyler de var.
english: ...and other things that make us happy.

text: ...Dragos ve çetesine vurduğunuz darbeyle iftihar ettik.
english: ...we're proud of the blow you've struck to Dragos and his gang.

text: Bahadırlığınıza bir kez daha hayran olduk.
english: We once again admire your contempt.

text: Ben yalnızca devletimin verdiği vazifeyi hakkıyla ifa etmeye çalıştım.
english: I was just trying to do my job properly.

text: O kadar kahramanlığın üstüne bir de mütevazı oluşu...
english: He's so brave and so humble.
...and it makes our three brains bigger in our eyes.

text: O kaleden çıkmak gerçekten büyük iş.
english: It's a real big job to get out of that fort.
...you had to pay your tax dollars.

text: Bu husus ziyadesiyle canımızı sıkacaktır tabii.
english: This is gonna be a little bit of a nuisance.
...and finally the life of Ilbilge Khatun is saved.

text: ...oradan sağ çıkmak için Dragos'a ne vaat ettin Ertuğrul Bey?
english: ...what did you promise Dragos to get out of there?
Some people used their own spoon to fill the place...

text: Bizim buraya gelmemizin tek nedeni, yemek yemek değildir.
english: The only reason we're here is not to eat.

text: Hayırlı bir iş için de geldik buraya.
english: We're here for a good cause.

text: Zira bir akrabalık ilişkisiyle birbirimize bağlanmamız...
english: Because we're bound together by a kinship relationship...

text: Bu vesileyle ben de düşünüp, kararımı verdim.
english: I thought about it and made my decision.
